no_internet.subTitle:
Your device is not connected to the internet.

This mode allows you to use the application without internet, but with some restrictions.

Your actions will be kept on your phone and sent when it recovers a connection to the internet.

Here is a list of actions that will not be available while the device is in offline mode:
no_internet.title: Offline mode

no_mqtt.subTitle:
Your internet connection does not allow you to receive new orders automatically.

We will try to re-establish the automatic communication mode as soon as your connection will allow.

Meanwhile, if you wish to refresh the list of orders, you can recover them manually by using the button:
no_mqtt.title: Connection to server not established

geolocation_utils.no_permission_to_access_location: The application has not been granted permission to access location. Please enable the required permission.

location-disclosure.title: Use of your location
location-disclosure.message1: The Mobilus application collects location data to enable tracking of your trips while you work. These data are made available to the dispatcher in your organization for work planning purposes : live tracking on a map of your position, dispatching task to you or your colleague and reporting features.
location-disclosure.message2: The location data will be collected when the app is in used, in the background, closed, or not in use. The location data will not be collected once you log out from the application.

noSequenceNumberAlert.message: Some orders do not have sequence numbers. Reorder your orders or optimize your route to have a direction with all orders or continue with current list.

map.tooManyWaypoints: Maximum number of orders to select has been reached. Only the first 10 orders will be displayed

walkthrough.confirmInstruction: Do you want to display an explanation about the buttons?

v2_4_x.availableInHelp:
Always available

You can always replay this introduction from Help in the menu on the left.
v2_4_x.byStatus:
By status actions

The following buttons:
  • Grouping
  • Sorting
  • Search and filter
now affect only the current status.
v2_4_x.filter:
Search and filter

The search tool allows you to find orders by name or address.

The Time Constraint filter displays only orders with such a constraint.

The tag filter displays orders that contain at least one of the selected tags.
v2_4_x.grouping:
Grouping

Allows to activate or deactivate order grouping by organization or type (delivery / pick-up).
v2_4_x.intro:
Daily actions are easily accessible.

You can hide unused buttons directly from Settings in the menu on the left.
v2_4_x.map:
Map view

Allows to view, orders, and their status, the organization location and your own location in one single view.

You have access to the same actions from this view as in the list view.
v2_4_x.multipleSelection:
Batch actions

Allows to select more than one order to process them together.
v2_4_x.optimize:
Optimize delivery sequence

Request server to calculate the best route for delivery.

This action is accessible only if your organization explicitly requested it.
v2_4_x.reorder:
Reorganize delivery sequence

Allows you to modify the sequence in which you will deliver orders.
v2_4_x.sorting:
Sort orders

Allows viewing orders according to one of the following sort choice:
  • Last name
  • Orders sequence
  • Distance (as the crow flies) from your current position
